summary: Completed testing of P2 user-configurable scheduler frequency feature. All backend API tests passed (9/9). Frontend UI tests passed - schedule frequency dropdown shows all 4 options and settings persist correctly.
passed_tests: GET /api/scheduler/status returns all 4 frequency jobs (hourly, 6h, 12h, daily)
GET /api/scheduler/status returns available_frequencies array with all 4 options
Scheduler is running with correct triggers (interval[1:00:00], interval[6:00:00], interval[12:00:00], cron[hour='12', minute='0'])
Settings persistence verified - GET returns updated schedule_frequency after POST
Frontend: Schedule Frequency dropdown found in Auto-Apply Settings dialog
Frontend: All 4 frequency options visible (Every hour, Every 6 hours, Every 12 hours, Once daily)
Frontend: Selecting frequency option updates UI correctly
Frontend: Save Settings button saves frequency to backend
Frontend: 'Settings saved!' toast notification appears after save

schedule_frequency_api.details: GET /api/auto-apply/settings returns schedule_frequency, POST accepts updates for all 4 values

frontend_dropdown.details: Schedule Frequency dropdown in Auto-Apply Settings dialog shows all 4 options with icons

settings_persistence.details: Frequency setting persists correctly after save - verified via API

critical_code_review_comments: AutoApplySettingsUpdate model correctly includes schedule_frequency field with valid options: 1h, 6h, 12h, daily, custom
Scheduler startup creates 4 jobs with correct triggers using IntervalTrigger and CronTrigger
scheduled_auto_apply_for_all_users function filters users by schedule_frequency setting
Frontend dropdown uses data-testid='schedule-frequency-select' for testing
Frontend shows dynamic description based on selected frequency (e.g., 'Runs every 6 hours')
context_for_next_testing_agent: P2 scheduler frequency feature fully tested and working. Backend has 4 APScheduler jobs (1h, 6h, 12h, daily) that filter users by their schedule_frequency setting. Frontend has a dropdown in Auto-Apply Settings dialog with all 4 options. Settings persist correctly via POST /api/auto-apply/settings.
